title: Follow the Arrow Cards
description_teacher: Students view a simple 3-arrow sequence (up, right, down) and click where a character would end up on a grid. Introduces the concept that pictures can represent directions.
student_prompt: The robot follows these arrows. Where does it end up?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: The robot follows these arrows. Where does it end up?

correct.message: Yes! The robot goes up, right, then down!
correct.audio_tts: Yes! The robot goes up, right, then down!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow each arrow one at a time.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow each arrow one at a time.
incorrect.hint_text: Start at the robot and follow: up, right, down

title: Match the Path to the Arrow Cards
description_teacher: Students match 3 simple arrow sequences to pictures showing where a character ends up. Reinforces that sequences of picture symbols produce specific outcomes.
student_prompt: Match each set of arrows to where the bunny ends up!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Match each set of arrows to where the bunny ends up!

correct.message: Perfect! You matched all the paths!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You matched all the paths!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow each arrow to see where it goes.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow each arrow to see where the bunny goes.
incorrect.hint_text: Start at the bunny and follow each arrow in order

title: Help the Cat Find the Food
description_teacher: Students drag 3 arrow cards into order to help a cat reach its food bowl on a simple grid. First experience creating a picture algorithm.
student_prompt: Drag the arrows to help the cat reach the food!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Drag the arrows to help the cat reach the food!

correct.message: Great! The cat got to the food!
correct.audio_tts: Great! The cat got to the food!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Try a different path.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Try a different path to reach the food.
incorrect.hint_text: The cat needs to go right, then up, then right again

title: Trace the Path Through the Grid
description_teacher: Students follow a 4-5 arrow sequence to trace a path through a 5x5 grid from start to finish, clicking each square along the way.
student_prompt: Follow the arrows to trace the path!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Follow the arrows to trace the path from start to finish!

correct.message: Perfect! You followed the arrows correctly!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You followed the arrows correctly!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow each arrow carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow each arrow carefully one at a time.
incorrect.hint_text: Start at the green square and move one square for each arrow

title: Create the Path to the Treasure
description_teacher: Students drag 4 arrow cards into sequence to create a path from a pirate to treasure on a grid. Practices creating picture-based algorithms.
student_prompt: Drag the arrows to help the pirate reach the treasure!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Drag the arrows to help the pirate reach the treasure!

correct.message: Awesome! The pirate found the treasure!
correct.audio_tts: Awesome! The pirate found the treasure!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Try a different path.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Try putting the arrows in a different order.
incorrect.hint_text: The pirate needs to go right twice, then up, then left

title: Which Path is Shorter?
short_name: Compare two picture algorithms for same goal
description_teacher: Students see two different arrow sequences that both reach the same goal and identify which one uses fewer steps. Introduces algorithm comparison.
student_prompt: Both paths reach the star. Which one is shorter?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Both paths reach the star. Which one uses fewer arrows?

correct.message: Yes! That path uses fewer arrows!
correct.audio_tts: Yes! That path uses fewer arrows!

incorrect.message: Try again! Count the arrows in each path.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Count how many arrows are in each path.
incorrect.hint_text: Path A has 3 arrows. Path B has 5 arrows.

title: Follow the Picture Recipe
description_teacher: Students follow a 5-picture sequence showing how to make lemonade and arrange outcome pictures in order. Reinforces following multi-step picture algorithms.
student_prompt: Follow the recipe pictures. What happens in order?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Follow the recipe pictures. What happens in order?

correct.audio_tts: Great! You followed the recipe correctly!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at each picture carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look at each recipe picture carefully.
incorrect.hint_text: Start with getting the lemons first

title: Arrows, Words, and Pictures: Same Path!
description_teacher: Students match three representations of the same algorithm: arrow symbols, word directions, and a path diagram. Introduces multiple ways to represent algorithms.
student_prompt: Match the different ways to show the same path!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Match the different ways to show the same path!

correct.message: Perfect! You matched all the representations!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You matched all the different ways to show the paths!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow each path carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow each path carefully to match them.
incorrect.hint_text: The arrows, words, and path should all go in the same direction

partially_correct.message: Good start! Check a few more.
partially_correct.audio_tts: Good start! Check a few more to make sure they match.

title: Picture Code to Word Code
description_teacher: Students view a sequence of arrow pictures and create the equivalent word sequence by dragging word cards. Practices translating between representations.
student_prompt: Look at the arrows. Drag the words to match!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at the arrows. Drag the words to match the same directions!

correct.message: Excellent! You translated the arrows to words!
correct.audio_tts: Excellent! You translated the arrows to words perfectly!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at each arrow carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look at each arrow and match it to the word.
incorrect.hint_text: An up arrow means forward. A curved arrow means turn.

partially_correct.audio_tts: Almost there! Check a few more words.

title: Fix the Path That's Wrong
short_name: Debug picture algorithm that doesn't reach goal
description_teacher: Students view a picture algorithm (arrow sequence) that doesn't reach the goal. They identify which arrow is wrong and select the correct replacement.
student_prompt: One arrow is wrong! Which one should we change?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: One arrow is wrong! Which one should we change to reach the goal?

correct.message: Yes! That arrow needs to change!
correct.audio_tts: Yes! That arrow needs to change!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow the path and see where it goes wrong.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow the path step by step and see where it goes wrong.
incorrect.hint_text: Follow each arrow. Which one makes the robot go the wrong way?

title: Create Your Own Map Code
description_teacher: Students create a 6-arrow sequence to navigate a character through a more complex grid with obstacles to reach a goal. Synthesizes algorithm creation skills.
student_prompt: Drag arrows to help the explorer reach the treasure!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Drag arrows to help the explorer reach the treasure! Watch out for rocks!

correct.message: Amazing! The explorer found the treasure!
correct.audio_tts: Amazing! The explorer found the treasure!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Try a different path around the rocks.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Try a different path to go around the rocks.
incorrect.hint_text: The explorer needs to go around the rocks to reach the treasure

partially_correct.message: Close! Just one or two arrows need to change.
partially_correct.audio_tts: Close! Just one or two arrows need to change.

title: Making a Sandwich: Two Big Parts
description_teacher: Students identify the two main parts of making a sandwich: get ingredients and make it.
student_prompt: What are the two big parts of making a sandwich?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: What are the two big parts of making a sandwich?

title: Getting Ready: What Parts?
short_name: Match task to its 2 main parts
description_teacher: Students match big tasks to pictures showing their 2 main parts.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Match each job to its big parts!

title: Put the Big Parts in Order
description_teacher: Students drag 2 picture cards showing main task parts into correct order.

description_teacher: Students sort 9 small task cards into 3 main groups for cleaning a room.

description_teacher: Students view 3-4 parts of making breakfast and identify which step is missing.
